intro: Tydaea venosa, commonly known as the slender tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and yellowish to brownish flower heads. Tydaea venosa is often found in moist meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
